column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Bi1 − xPbxCuSeO (x = 0, 0.02, …, 0.2) samples were prepared by a self-propagating high-temperature synthesis and SHS-SPS technique.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts of Bi (99.99%, Aladdin), Bi2O3 (99.99%, Aladdin), PbO (99.9%, Aladdin), Cu (99.99%, Aladdin), and Se (99.99%, Aladdin) were mixed by hand grinding.
#Text=The mixed powders were cold pressed into pellets and underwent the SHS processes.
#Text=The details of the SHS method can be found elsewhere23.
#Text=Given that a significant volatilization of Se may exist during the SHS processes, additional 5 at% Se was added.
#Text=The obtained SHSed powders were then compacted into dense pellets with a diameter of ~12.5 mm and a height of ~10 mm by SPS at 923 K under a uniaxial pressure of 50 MPa for 5 min.
